title: Debugging Hangs when default terminal app doesn't exist
body:
To test: Set Terminal.External.LinuxExec to an app that doesn't exist.

Start debugging with external terminal (I used the C++ extension and set `externalConsole` to `true`). 

Expected: 

Failure response for RunInTerminal command.

Actual:
No Response from VS Code's debugadapter protocol.
UI looks like it is waiting for debugging to start.

title: Allow to use `resourceLangId` configuration for in-memory files
body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- Also please test using the latest insiders build to make sure your issue has not already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.30.2
- OS Version: Mac 10.14.2

Steps to Reproduce:
I am working on a vscode extension but found an issue with `resourceLangId`. Below is my configuration. It tries to render a title on editor when it open a file which has language id as `mongodbRunner`.

```
"editor/title": [
        {
          "when": "resourceLangId == mongodbRunner",
          "command": "mongoRunner.launchEditor"
        }
      ]
```
It works for the file loaded from disk but it doesn't work for in-memory file. 

`vscode.workspace.openTextDocument({ content: text, language: 'mongodbRunner' });
`

The editor title is not shown until I save the file on disk.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes/No Yes

title: VS Code breaks `<pre>` indention when pasting, even with "Format on Paste" turned off.
body:
VS Code 13.0.2 on Windows 10. If I copy and paste in a section of HTML which includes `
` block, VS Code converts the spaces inside the `
` block to tabs!! VS code should never touch the indentation inside the `
` blocks. For example:

```html
	
```

This code section has a combination of tabs and spaces for indentation. The space indentation is crucial for the preformatted `
` blocks. But VS code changes them to spaces when I paste; basically my editor is corrupting my content!

What adds insult to injury is that I have `Editor: Format on Paste` _turned off_. So VC Code should paste my content _exactly as I give it_. It has no business making _any_ changes, because I have told it not to.

People can debate all day about tabs vs spaces, about how the editor should guess the indentation, what happens with mixed indentation, etc. But when turn off `Editor: Format on Paste`, it should make _no changes_. Surely no one can argue with that.

Please fix this huge bug which corrupts content.

title: [json] jsonValidation fileMatch is confusing when used with URIs

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
- VSCode Version: 1.30.2
- OS Version: macOS 10.14.3

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create an extension that [registers a text document content provider](https://code.visualstudio.com/api/references/vscode-api#2290) for a custom scheme, say `custom`.  Implement the provider to return a json object as text.
2. Declare a jsonValidation in package.json with a `fileMatch` of `custom://*.todo`.
3. [Open](https://code.visualstudio.com/api/references/vscode-api#2246) a text document for a uri under that custom scheme with path ending in something.todo, and also a defined query or fragment [1], then [set text document language](https://code.visualstudio.com/api/references/vscode-api#2319) to 'json', and [show it](https://code.visualstudio.com/api/references/vscode-api#2074).
4. Expect the json schema validation to occur on the virtual file.
5. Note that it does not.

It appears the `fileMatch` matches on the entire uri, including the query and the fragment!  You can verify this by changing the `fileMatch` to `custom://*.todo?*`

It should probably only match on the path.

[1] e.g. `custom:/path/to/something.todo?foo`

title: Add setting to disable the dirtyWarning
body:
When an unsaved file is open in a tab, a UI element pops up if it is being closed with unsaved changes:

![screenshot from 2019-01-27 10-31-10](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/520669/51805140-c0c4d880-221e-11e9-83cf-de5fc1313240.png)

Often my projects re-open (e.g. after a reboot) with files that are no longer there and when I close them I have to leave the keyboard to click the UI.

Thanks for VS code, it is great! I'm happy I was able to just search for the [line][1] "Your changes will be lost if you don't save them." and find what I was looking for.

[1]: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/b4fc71b972eae2425d39ac4041df0c36cfa1bb37/src/vs/workbench/parts/files/electron-browser/fileActions.ts#L279

title: Drag and Drop "dotfile" to File Explorer creates file without leading "dot"
body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- Also please test using the latest insiders build to make sure your issue has not already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.30.2 (user setup)
- OS Version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.17763

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open Folder in VS Code that contains a "dotfile" e.g. ".gitignore", ".env", ".htaccess"
2. Drag and Drop a "dotfile" to the windows file explorer. The pasted file name does not contain leading "dot" e.g. "gitignore" instead of ".gitignore"

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

title: Feature Request: Global override of indentationRules
files.exclude excluded files should NOT be excluded from quick find
body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- Also please test using the latest insiders build to make sure your issue has not already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.30.2
- OS Version: macOS 10.13.6

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Set files.exclude to include the glob "**/*.test.js"
2. Try to load a file via Cmd-P - test files are now erroneously excluded from this as well.  How else are we supposed to load them?

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

We colocate test files with their paired file, so `foo.js` and `foo.test.js` are in the same dir.  This leads to a lot of test files that obscure the list of regular files.  So we set `files.exclude` to include the glob `**/*.test.js` - great so tests are excluded from the file explorer.  But now they are also not quick-loadable when I do Cmd-P and start typing out the name of the file.

This is not the optimal abstraction.  Excluded test files should not be shown in the file explorer but ***SHOULD*** be shown when searching for them via Cmd-P.  Otherwise, how else are we supposed to load them?

Thanks!

title: Word selection doesn't work as usual for "cursorWordStartRight"
body:
- VSCode Version: 1.31.0
- OS Version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.17763

The issue described in the following bug report was fixed for cursorWordRight and cursorWordEndRight, but the exact problem remains when using **cursorWordStartRight**. It also fails for cursorWordStartLeft/cursorWordEndLeft:
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/48046

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Enter this text in the editor: foo.bar();
2. Bind ctrl+right to cursorWordStartRight
3. Press ctrl+right a couple times, cursor moves to just before the dot, then to just after the dot.  Cursor should instead move directly from the 'f' to the 'b', as the '.' is a word delimiter rather than the start of an actual word.

Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

title: Unifying "do X on save" functionality

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
**Problem**
VS Code ships with multiple actions that can be triggered on save, including:

- Trim trailing whitespace
- Trim trailing new line
- format document
- code actions (such as `organize imports` and `fix all`)

Each of these actions currently has its own setting. Many of the setting names are generic so it may not be clear they apply on save. 

**Goals**
- Make it easier to discover built-in `do X on save` actions
- Give these settings a more consistent names 
- Potentially allow these actions to be used in a more flexible way (such as from the source action menu)

/cc @kieferrm

title: Allow extensions to change { -> } completion to { -> };

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
This is from feedback in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-cpptools/issues/3087 .

I found the editor.autoClosingBrackets "languageDefined" setting, but I don't see a way for our C/C++ extension to modify this. We need to run our lexer to check if the tokens before the { belong to the start of a struct/class/etc. definition to determine if the "completion" for { should be } or };.

Visual Studio implements this scenario correctly.

title: Exclude files by right clicking result in search panel
body:
Right now we can dismiss files and folders in the search result, but it would be a nice shortcut to be able to add them to the excluded files by right-clicking the file or folder in the results:

![screenshot from 2019-01-24 12 24 37](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7832163/51704494-73eec100-1fd6-11e9-86af-f7d6cfdeb397.png)

That way you could easily exclude them to let you tweak your search string and ignore any results that you don't want. This would be especially helpful for large projects or multi-folder workspaces.

title: Debugger does not respect skipFiles
body:
Version: 1.30.1
Commit: dea8705087adb1b5e5ae1d9123278e178656186a
Date: 2018-12-18T18:12:07.165Z
Electron: 2.0.12
Chrome: 61.0.3163.100
Node.js: 8.9.3
V8: 6.1.534.41
OS: Windows_NT x64 6.1.7601

Version: 1.31.0-insider
Commit: 2d79ffe0cd84515a4c771fcbd7294c2448d97826
Date: 2019-01-23T06:20:52.488Z
Electron: 3.0.13
Chrome: 66.0.3359.181
Node.js: 10.2.0
V8: 6.6.346.32
OS: Windows_NT x64 6.1.7601

node v11.7.0

Debug launch config:
```
    {
      "type": "node",
      "request": "launch",
      "name": "Debug server",
      //"console": "integratedTerminal",
      "program": "${workspaceFolder}/example/server.js",
      "protocol": "inspector",
      "skipFiles": [
        "${workspaceFolder}/node_modules/**/*.js",
        "<node_internals>/**/*.js"
      ],
      "stopOnEntry": false
    },
```
<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

Debugger is ignoring `skipFiles` with 1.30.1 and behaving erratically with 1.31.0-insider.
Consider the following situation:
![fig-1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15155315/51667804-0f753700-1fc1-11e9-8c91-27e4c29c6bcf.png)

Given what is witten in [Skipping uninteresting code](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/nodejs/nodejs-debugging#_skipping-uninteresting-code-node-chrome),
> If you step into a skipped file, you won't stop there - you will stop on the next executed line that is not in a skipped file.

I assume that being the debugger stopped at line `35`, either pressing `Step Over` or `Step Into` I'd immediately stop at line `37`.
Here's instead what happens.

## 1.30.1

- `Step Over`, debugger stops at line `37`
- `Step Into`, debugger ignores `skipFiles` and stops into `${workspaceFolder}/node_modules/lunr/lunr.js`

![fig-2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15155315/51667958-6713a280-1fc1-11e9-9312-14b893a6087d.png)

You can see in the call stack that `lunr.js` is grayed, ie considered skipped, but nonetheless debugger stops in it.

## 1.31.0-insider

- `Step Over`, debugger stops at line `37`
- `Step Into`, the stop indicator in the gutter and the line highlight turn greenish and debugger stays stopped there.

![fig-3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15155315/51668079-b8239680-1fc1-11e9-8c4d-89e95db5fbf9.png)

From this moment on, any further press of either `Step Over` or `Step Into` or `Step Out` is ignored and the debugger is stuck there.

title: postDebugTask running if debug mode briefly turns off then on
Space as end of hyperlink isn't always good idea
body:
- VSCode Version: 1.30.2
- OS Version: Win 7

Currently, any space after hyperlink automatically breaks it. Generally it's OK, but it breaks link highlighting in AsciiDoctor.

Example:

```
https://foo.bar/[this is foo site]
```

And here is how it will look inside VS Code:

![bug](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18004961/46442449-57522300-c772-11e8-8620-1d04416fa460.PNG)

As you see, the syntax highlighting isn't correct. Aslo, if you click this link, it will open incorrect address:

```
https://foo.bar/[this
```

This issue was originally posted here: https://github.com/asciidoctor/asciidoctor-vscode/issues/116

> VSCode seems to recognize as link any uri identifier (`file:`, `http:`, etc...) followed by any non-space characters. Something like this I guess: `(https?|file)://\S+`

It would be nice to have an option to manually adjust this regex in app's settings (File > Preferences > Settings).

title: vscode does not allow to type / keyboard not working inside vscode / vscode does not allow to edit files
body:
** Keyboard is not working inside vscode **
After I updated vscode to version 1.30.2, I am not able to edit/type in any files opened in it. It just does not recognize keyboard strokes.

**Describe the bug**

OS and Version: OSX High Sierra
VS Code Version: 1.30.2

Extensions you installed (and if the issue persists after disabling them): Salesforce extension pack, ESLint, Python, Chrome Debugger

Does not allow to type inside editor.
**vscode is a very good editor. I was seeing this error in my mac and windows machines occasionally. Usually this error went away when I restarted vscode. But this time in my Mac, it is not allowing me to edit the file at all even after multiple restarts.
Please come up with a permanent fix for this issue for all OS platforms. This is actually the only frustrating issue with vscode and makes it unusable and leaves people with no option other than than going for some other editor.**

**To Reproduce**
Open any project folder
Open any file
Start typing inside file

**Expected behavior**
Typed characters should show in UI

title: Clear all problems in the 'Problems' pane with a button

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
Please add a button in the `Problems` pane that allows the developer to clear all items in there.

**Following discussions from #15524, #29169, #66343 and #50448.**

Currently we see problems from different sources (linters, tasks, etc) and they sometimes stay there after the problem or the source file is gone, e.g. problems in an unsaved buffer, in files that were renamed, or files removed when we switch Git branches.

More often than not I have a bunch of problems and the only way to clear that pane is to restart the entire editor.

title: Explorer: resolve all folders before filtering

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

body:
Recently, support for filtering in Explorer by typing parts of a file or folder name was added (#66497). There are two modes:

The default mode simply highlights all matches in currently expanded folders and scrolls to the first found match. Works perfectly, nicely engineered.

By activating the "Filter on Type" mode, the tree gets pruned to only those elements that match the filter. However, this pruning currently removes all folders which had not been expanded at least once before-hand, no matter if they contain a match or not.

In my opinion, the behavior of the Filter on Type mode is counterintuitive as the results shouldn't depend on how the developer has interacted with the tree in advance. At least then there should be some indication on which folders were not considered in the search. In my case, I commonly want to filter on specific file types, and since there is no "Expand All" feature in the Explorer, the current work-around would be to manually expand all folders upfront and then use the new filter feature so that I can be sure that no entries are missing.

I'm assuming this is related to the fact that folder nodes are lazily resolved since they might be remote resources. On the other hand, the normal search functionality seems to have no problem with these scenarios, probably because the expectation is that it's OK to wait a bit until you get the results, whereas here you more or less want it immediately. Maybe a hybrid would be a good solution: do the quick filtering as it is and display that immediately, and in the background start a regular filename search backed by (still experimental) [search provider API](https://code.visualstudio.com/updates/v1_24#_search-provider-api). Then merge these when the results come in.

@isidorn

title: Add "accept theirs", "accept ours" git commands/context menu actions

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
I'm not sure how much this is due to me not being familiar with merging conflicts in vscode but I'm finding it next to impossible to use. For files with conflicts which vscode recognises (i.e. .py files) when I open the conflicted file it displays a bar at the top allow me to select the incoming changes or local changes. For all other files there doesn't seem to be any way to accept / reject changes even at the file level (i.e. accept/reject all incoming changes)

i.e. I have an ipynb file with conflicts. Under MERGE CHANGES it has a C beside it. If I open the file it doesn't present and options to diff or merge the files. I have `nbdime` installed but not sure how to configure it with vscode. But the issue also occurs for .log files etc.

If I right click on the files under MERGE CHANGES, there are options to 'Accept All Current' or 'Accept All Incoming'. Neither of these appear to do anything, there's no change to the indicators - the C icon is still displayed, and trying to stage continues to presents the warning "are you sure you want to stage xyz.ipynb with merge conflicts"

I'm having to resort to command line merging.

title: VS Code not straight ruler
body:
Hi everyone.

I have a linter that checks for lines of size 100, and I was looking for a way to create a ruler of also size 100 that guides me whenever I surpassed that value. That was easy.

The thing is, inside the linter options, a tab is considered as 1 character when it visually takes 4 spaces long.

I think it could be good to take into consideration a variable tab size option for rulers; Although It will not look like a straight line, you'd get an idea at what moment your code surpasses the linter limit.

title: Increase size (width) of minimap is not possible
body:
It is not possible to increase the size of the minimap. The default setting is a little bit small on very large screens with a high resolution.

```javascript
"editor.minimap.maxColumn": 400
```

Maybe this is related to https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/20931 where max width is `150px`

Version: 1.30.2 (system setup)
Commit: 61122f88f0bf01e2ac16bdb9e1bc4571755f5bd8
Date: 2019-01-07T22:54:13.295Z
Electron: 2.0.12
Chrome: 61.0.3163.100
Node.js: 8.9.3

OS: Windows_NT x64 10.0.17134

title: List highlight filter: Support other filters

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
It would be nice to have option to disable fuzzy match on folders/files.
Use case:
I'm looking for Webpack loaders inside `node_modules`. If I type `load` or even `loade` I will have a lot of matchings like `global-modules-path`, `load-json-file`, `lodash.clonedeep` and several files inside opened `src` and `test` folders.
In particular case I can search for `loader` ant it will still match `babel-plugin-transform-es2015-shorthand-properties`, `src/utils/check-local-folder.ts` etc.

Ability to disable fuzzy much for similar cases will drastically reduce number of matches that are not relevant.

As mentioned in #66912 it might be added to added to List filter widget, same panel as "Filter on type" toggle.
